SENT.plain: A case of persistent bilateral perilunate dislocation unrelated to trauma in a patient with Marfan syndrome is discussed
This finding is believed to be a manifestation of the generalized ligamentous laxity occurring in this disorder
Radiographs of eight additional Marfan syndrome patients failed to demonstrate similar carpal instability
Because some carpal derangements are dynamic events, stress views or wrist fluoroscopy may be necessary to demonstrate unsuspected carpal instability in Marfan patients
